description.description: The public description of the WAF rule.
description.example: SQL injection prevention for SELECT statements

group.description: The rule group to which the current WAF rule belongs.

id.description: The unique identifier of the rule group.

name.description: The name of the rule group.

id.description: The unique identifier of the WAF rule.

package_id.description: The unique identifier of a WAF package.

priority.description: The order in which the individual WAF rule is executed within its rule group.

allowed_modes.description: The list of possible actions of the WAF rule when it is triggered.

items.description: The action that the current WAF rule will perform when triggered. Applies to traditional (deny) WAF rules.

default_mode.description: The default action/mode of a rule.

mode.description: The action that the current WAF rule will perform when triggered. Applies to traditional (deny) WAF rules.

description: When triggered, traditional WAF rules cause the firewall to immediately act upon the request based on the configuration of the rule. A 'deny' rule will immediately respond to the request based on the configured rule action/mode (for example, 'block') and no other rules will be processed.
title: Traditional (deny) WAF rule
